page.title: 02Clayton-le-Woods: 2
page.content:
The south west corner of the area is occupied by an{ammunition factory,} Royal Ordnance PLC, which was built during the Second World War and has recently been privatised. An old {timber framed building,}Buckshaw Hall, is within the factory grounds and so is inaccessible to the public. Negotiations are taking place with a view to moving the hall to a new site, possibly in the grounds of Euxton Hall, about four kilometres south of its present site. Old{cotton mills}in Whittle-le-Woods are now being used mainly by small metal-working firms.
{Traffic congestion}on the A6 through Whittle-le-Woods has been relieved by the opening of a new link road to the M61 at Walton Summit three kilometres north of the village.
